nme.Lib

type
class

Static Variables

ALLOW_SHADERS : Int

BORDERLESS : Int

DEPTH_BUFFER : Int

FULLSCREEN : Int

HARDWARE : Int

HW_AA : Int

HW_AA_HIRES : Int

MAX_FLOAT_VALUE : Float

MIN_FLOAT_VALUE : Float

REQUIRE_SHADERS : Int

RESIZABLE : Int

STENCIL_BUFFER : Int

VSYNC : Int

company(get_company,null) : String

current(get_current,null) : nme.display.MovieClip

file(get_file,null) : String

initHeight(get_initHeight,null) : Int

initWidth(get_initWidth,null) : Int

packageName(get_packageName,null) : String

stage(get_stage,null) : nme.display.Stage

version(get_version,null) : String

Static Methods

close() : Void

Closes the application. This is method is ignored in the Flash and HTML5 targets.

create(onLoaded : Void -> Void, width : Int, height : Int, ?frameRate : Float, ?color : Int, ?flags : Int, ?title : String, ?icon : nme.display.BitmapData) : Void

parameters
onLoaded A method callback that is called once the window is created.
width The requested width of the window. Use a width and height of 0 to request the full screen size.
height The requested height of the window. Use a width and height of 0 to request the full screen size.
frameRate The requested frame rate for the application.
color An RGB color to use for the application background.
flags A series of bit flags which can specify windowing options, like FULLSCREEN or HARDWARE
title The title to use when creating the application window.
icon An icon to use for the created application window.
Creates a new application window. If you are using the NME command-line tools, this method will be called automatically as a part of the default platform templates. This is method is ignored in the Flash and HTML5 targets.

createManagedStage(width : Int, height : Int) : Unknown

parameters
width The requested width of the managed stage.
height The requested width of the managed stage.
Creates a managed stage, for greater control customization and control of application events. This method is ignored in the Flash and HTML5 targets.

exit() : Void

Similar to the close() method, but the current Stage object is given an opportunity to handle the quit event before the application process is ended. This method is ignored in the Flash and HTML5 targets.

forceClose() : Void

Terminates the application process immediately without performing a clean shutdown. This method is ignored in the Flash and HTML5 targets.

inline getTimer() : Int

returns
A relative time value in milliseconds.
Returns the time in milliseconds, relative to the start of the application. This is a high performance call in order to help regulate time-based operations. Depending upon the target platform, this value may or may not be an absolute timestamp. If you need an exact time, you should use the Date object.

getURL(url : nme.net.URLRequest, ?target : String) : Void

parameters
url The URL to open.
target An optional window target value.
Opens a browser window with the specified URL.

pause() : Void

For supported platforms, the NME application will be paused. This can help improve response times if fullscreen native UI element is being used temporarily. This method is ignored in the Flash and HTML5 targets.

postUICallback(handler : Void -> Void) : Void

parameters
handler The method handler you wish to call when the UI is available.
For some target platforms, NME operates on a separate thread than the native application UI. In these cases, you can use this method to make thread-safe calls to the native UI. If the platform does not require thread-safe callbacks, the handler method will be called immediately.

resume() : Void

Resumes the NME application. For certain platforms, pausing the application can improve response times when a fullscreen native UI element is being displayed. This method is ignored in the Flash and HTML5 targets.

setPackage(company : String, file : String, packageName : String, version : String) : Void

parameters
company The company name for the application.
file The file name for the application.
packageName The package name of the application.
version The version string of the application.
Specifies meta-data for the running application. If you are using the NME command-line tools, this method will be called automatically as a part of the default platform templates. This method is ignored in the Flash and HTML5 targets.

trace(arg : Dynamic) : Void

parameters
arg
Sends a trace call for the current platform.
